# Fine-tuning with LoRA

## Overview
This recipe demonstrates how to fine-tune a pre-trained model using Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) for efficient training.

## Important Considerations
- LoRA reduces memory requirements compared to full fine-tuning
- Suitable for domain adaptation and task-specific training
- Preserves base model knowledge while learning new tasks

## Training Tips
- Choose appropriate LoRA rank (typically 8-64)
- Monitor training loss and validation metrics
- Adjust learning rate and batch size based on task

## Expected Outcomes
After training, the model should:
- Show improved performance on target domain
- Maintain general language capabilities
- Have smaller parameter footprint than full fine-tuning
